author: Bobby Olivier | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Nick Gordon takes legal action against Browns; murder charge rumors swirl
text:
Nick Gordon hopes to plead the Fifth for now.
TMZ.com reports Bobbi Kristina Brown's beau has asked a judge to postpone the $40 million wrongful death lawsuit filed against him until the criminal process surrounding Brown's death is finished.
Gordon hopes to stay quiet, citing his right to remain silent and that the wrongful death civil case could yield answers to be used against him if criminal charges come to pass, TMZ said Tuesday.
MORE: Leolah Brown: Bobbi Kristina Brown, Whitney Houston were murdered
Moreover, the 25-year-old fears the Brown family's accusations toward him will lead to an unfair trial. In the documents cited by TMZ, Gordon reportedly says that the Browns have portrayed him as a "murderer, a habitual batterer of women, a seducer of young white females" and more.
This move comes as rumors of impending murder charges against Gordon have been more pronounced. US Weekly reported Tuesday afternoon that a Georgia district attorney has convened a secret grand jury with the intent of charging Gordon.
Leolah Brown, Bobby Brown's sister, recently told Inside Edition she believes Gordon killed Bobbi Kristina.
Bobbi Kristina was found unresponsive Jan. 31 in her home in suburban Atlanta by Gordon and a friend. She died on July 26 at age 22.
